context_note: On 12.09.2019, at [redacted] in [redacted] village, close to GRC-BGR borders, HP officers from [redacted] apprehended twenty six (26) irregular migrants. location_details: Incidents occurred at the Lithuanian border where 15 migrants were detected in Lithuanian territory and subsequently directed from the territory. Lithuanian authorities applied preventive measures to 8 persons and 7 persons separately, directing them from the territory of Lithuania.
location_text_raw: Lithuanian territory, at the border signal
context_note: The SIR concerns incidents on 13 January 2022 where Lithuanian authorities applied 'preventive measures' to 15 migrants (8 and 7 persons in two separate incidents) who had crossed into Lithuanian territory, directing them back from the territory. This practice is linked to a new national border management procedure from August 2021, which prevents asylum seekers from being admitted if they cross outside designated border crossing points. The Fundamental Rights Officer assesses these actions as likely violating several fundamental rights, including the right to asylum, prohibition of collective expulsion, non-refoulement, and right to life and human dignity, due to lack of individual assessment and effective access to asylum procedures, and the risk of chain-refoulement.
evidence_quote: On 13 January 2022 preventive measures were applied to 8 persons, and they were directed from the territory of Lithuania... On 13 January 2022, the preventive measures were applied to 7 persons, and they were directed from the territory of Lithuania.

location_details: Three underage migrants died of hypothermia approximately 20 km from the Bulgarian-Turkish border, on Bulgarian territory. location_text_raw: approximately 20 km from the Bulgarian-Turkish border; Position 1 at 42°15'43"N 27°19'56"E; Position 2 at 42°17'00″N 27°19'36"E; Position 3 at 42°17'54"N 27°19'37"E
uncertainty_note: Bodies were found near the reported alert positions, with deviations of 22m, 8m, and 4km respectively.
context_note: Three underage migrants died of hypothermia near the Bulgarian-Turkish border after crossing from Türkiye. NGOs alerted Bulgarian emergency services multiple times with precise locations, but authorities allegedly failed to react and actively obstructed NGO rescue attempts, leading to significant delays in reaching the migrants. The Fundamental Rights Office concluded that Bulgarian authorities failed to assist and rescue migrants, violating the right to life and child protection obligations.

Allegedly, the Bulgarian authorities not only did not react to the alerts, but also actively obstructed the NGOs' rescue attempts which resulted in a more than 24-hour delay in reaching the reported positions where the migrants' bodies were found.

context_note: On 24/01/2025, the Fundamental Rights Office received information about an alleged irregular return of 8 migrants from Bulgaria to Greece, conducted by masked police officers. Migrants were allegedly body-searched, had belongings confiscated, loaded into a police vehicle, driven, released, and commanded to walk towards Greece. They were later apprehended by Hellenic Police in Greece. The Fundamental Rights Office could not independently verify the incident. Migrant's testimony is not corroborated by Bulgarian authorities or other evidence. Bulgarian authorities deny any apprehension in their territory, while Hellenic authorities reported migrants crossed from Bulgaria to Greece. The Office notes similarities with a previous SIR (13800/2022) involving alleged pushbacks by Bulgarian border police.
evidence_quote: The Fundamental Rights Office was not able to independently verify that the incident happened as alleged by the migrant. The migrant's testimony, supported by the account from the Hellenic authorities, is not corroborated by the information provided by the Bulgarian authorities nor by any other available evidence.

location_details: Four migrants were apprehended by Frontex and Lithuanian border guards after crossing from Belarus to Lithuania, and subsequently redirected to Belarus.
context_note: Lithuanian authorities explain that Decision No. 42 of 2 August 2021, adopted under a state-level emergency, restricts entry to functioning international border crossing points. The FRO observes that while Article 15 ECHR allows derogations, it does not justify denying effective access to asylum or non-refoulement. Access to designated points appears neither genuine nor effective in practice, and no individual vulnerability assessment was conducted before returning migrants to Belarus, despite reports of mistreatment by Belarusian authorities. The FRO recommends administrative closure but notes the events may amount to serious breaches of fundamental rights.

context_note: On 21st April, a grey rubber boat with about 80 persons on board was sighted adrift 40 nautical miles North East of Tripoli, Libya. FSA informed MRCC Rome, Malta, Tunis, and Libya. Due to deteriorating weather, distress communications were broadcasted. Libyan Coast Guard requested Italian MRCC to divert ships. Merchant vessels "ALK", "LISBETH", and "MY ROSE" proceeded to assist. On 22nd April, an empty, partially deflated rubber boat was spotted approximately 51 nautical miles North of Tripoli. A floating body was sighted. NGO vessel "OCEAN VIKING" and merchant vessel "MY ROSE" were also in the area. "MY ROSE" communicated finding three additional bodies, bringing their total to eight. Media outlets reported up to 120 migrants might have died. Frontex surveillance aircraft performed three flights on 21-22 April. The shipwreck likely occurred between the return of the Frontex aircraft on 21.04 and the arrival of merchant vessels. Italian authorities confirmed that under Libyan Rescue Center coordination, three merchant ships assisted, and a Libyan patrol boat rescued 104 people from one of two boats.

The Fundamental Rights Office notes with serious concern that allegations of the involvement of Greek officers and unidentified other men (masked, Arabic and Kurdish speakers) accessing the migrants, despite the authorities' claims that the migrants could not be located, in order to violently push them back out of Greek territory, are numerous in Evros region. So are the reports of detention in the Greek territory without following proper registration procedures, and subsequent pushback. Such and other activities have been alleged, inter alia, in [redacted]. Against the backdrop of the overall credibility of migrants' accounts taken together, as well as other documentary evidence, the Fundamental Rights Office believes that the Greek authorities' blanket dismissal of all allegations raised in the framework of this SIR remains an important obstacle to a meaningful follow up in the form of effective investigations.

context_note: The Fundamental Rights Office was made aware of Frontex operational reporting about apprehended migrants being brought to a redacted location for registration and allegedly held for hours in degrading conditions. On 30/09/2024, one migrant fainted while being locked in a garage-like structure with other 30 migrants for at least 14 hours. It was also reported that the same day at around 17:00 at least 45 migrants were held in the garage, with 30 of them already being there no less than 20 hours.
